title: The String Quartet Tribute To Tool's Aenima
description:
The cryptic videos for "Sober" and "Prison Sex" provided the initial glimpse of the dark imaginations of Tool. While Undertow made the band popular, Ãƒâ€ nima made them a phenomenon. The album stunned audiences in 1996 and brought the avant-garde to the mainstream. Complex instrumental passages echoed Pink Floyd. Cryptic lyrics rewarded thoughtful listening. And the band?s intense performances were decidedly metal. Ãƒâ€ nima launched Tool into their own universe. Ten years later, it is still a worthwhile visit.

The String Quartet Tribute to Tool?s Ãƒâ€ nima is a breathtaking journey through Tool?s masterpiece. A handpicked group of musicians have used violins, viola, and cello to explore the emotional depths of such songs as "Forty-Six & 2" and "Third Eye." Each movement of the bow elicits moody and nuanced notes. These string interpretations prove that Tool are truly modern day composers.
